contentrichtext.text: '''RLS''' may stand for: * [[Robert Louis Stevenson]] (1850-1894), Scottish author * [[Rutgers Law School (disambiguation)]] * [[Restless legs syndrome]], a medical disorder * [[Reversing language shift]], a model for revitalizing endangered languages * [[Real-life superhero]], a person who dresses and/or acts like comic book superheroes * [[Royal Latin School]], a grammar school in Buckingham, England * [[Stevenson School]], formerly known as Robert Louis Stevenson School, in California * [[Recursive least squares filter]], an adaptive filter algorithm for digital signal processing * [[Rial (disambiguation)]], plurally abbreviated Rls, units of currency in several middle-eastern countries * "[[Rebel Love Song]]," a song by American rock band Black Veil Brides * Real-life slash, a sub-genre of [[Real person fiction]] == See also == * [[RSL (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation}}
